title.narrative: Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Environment Improvement Project (Phase II)

description.narrative:
The goal of this Project is improved air and water quality in the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region (IMAR) by rehabilitation and construction of more efficient and less polluting heating supply systems.
.

participating-org.narrative: Government of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region-Development and Reform Commission
Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Finance Department (Former Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved air quality in urban areas in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region (IMAR)

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

By 2018, energy-efficient district heating and natural gas supplies in urban areas avoid coal consumption by at least 1.76 million tons, thereby avoiding annual emissions of CO2 by more than 2.66 million tons, SO2 by more than 31,165 tons, TSP by more than 38,440 tons, and NOx by more than 6,894 tons.

description.narrative: Improved air quality in urban areas in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region (IMAR)

title.narrative: The air quality in project areas improve to at least grade II by 2018.

description.narrative: Improved air quality in urban areas in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region (IMAR)
